page.title: 01FOBBING CHURCH
page.content: We had to climb up about one hundred spiral steps to get to the top of St Michael's Church,{Fobbing.}We looked}though our binoculars and we could see a clearing in{Wat Tyler {Country Park,}here a pill box stands.Pill boxes were built during the second world war to defend the coast against the Germans.In a field we saw some cows, sheep and horses grazing.In{Pitsea}there are two tips. One is the council tip which takes industrial rubbish,the other tip is the GLC tip which takes household rubbish.By the marshes there is a cricket and a football pitch.From the top of the tower we could see two or three mustard fields.The tower was 21.34 metres high.The main thing we saw up the tower was Fobbing marshes which took up a large amount of land in our area.
